post.description: Create a transfer beneficiary

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

account_number.description: The beneficiary's bank account number. When testing on staging, you can find a list of all the available test bank accounts [here](https://developer.flutterwave.com/docs/test-bank-accounts)

account_bank.description: This is the beneficiaryâ€™s bank code, you can use the [List of Banks](ref:list-of-banks-for-transfer)  to retrieve a bank code.

beneficiary_name.description: This is the name of the beneficiary.

currency.description: This is the based of the country of the beneficiary bank. If country is KE, supply KES, if NG, supply NGN

bank_name.description: This is the name of the beneficiary bank

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request POST '{{BASE_API_URL}}/beneficiaries' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}'
--data-raw '{
    "account_bank": "044",
    "account_number": "0690000034",
    "beneficiary_name": "Ade Bond",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "bank_name": "ACCESS BANK NIGERIA"
}'
code-samples.name: cUrl
Node

code-samples.code:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => "{{BASE_API_URL}}/beneficiaries",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
  CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS =>"{\n\t\"account_number\": \"0690000034\",\n\t\"account_bank\": \"044\"\n,\n\t\"beneficiary_name\": \"Ade Bond\"\n}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
    "Content-Type: application/json",
    "Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}"
  ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;
code-samples.name: Php

code-samples.code:
require "uri"
require "net/http"

url = URI("{{BASE_API_URL}}/beneficiaries")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port);
request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)
request["Content-Type"] = "application/json"
request["Authorization"] = "Bearer {SEC_KEY}"
request.body = "{\n\t\"account_number\": \"0690000034\",\n\t\"account_bank\": \"044\"\n,\n\t\"beneficiary_name\": \"Ade Bond\"\n}"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

post.description: Create a tokenized charge

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token on the request header to authorize this call

token.description: This is the card token returned from the transaction verification endpoint as `data.card.token`

email.description: This is the email address of the customer. Note: This has to be the exact email address passed during the initial charge.

currency.description: This is the specified currency to charge the card in, It can be `NGN`, `GHS`, `KES`, `UGX`, `TZS`, `USD` etc.

country.description: This is the ISO country code of the merchant e.g. `NG`, `GH`, `KE` etc.

amount.description: This is the amount to be charged

tx_ref.description: This is a unique reference, unique to the particular transaction being carried out.

first_name.description: This is the first name of the card holder or the customer

last_name.description: This is the last name of the card holder or the customer

ip.description: IP - Internet Protocol. This represents the IP address of where the transaction is being carried out.

narration.description: This is a custom description added by the merchant

device_fingerprint.description: This is the fingerpringt for the device being used. It can be generated using a library on whatever platform is being used

payment_plan.description: This is the ID of the plan you want to subscribe to. It is returned in the call to create a payment plan as `data.id`

subaccounts.description: This is an array of objects containing the subaccount IDs to split the payment into. Subaccount ID's are returned in the call to create a subaccount as `data.subaccount_id`

id.description: This is the unique Id returned in the call to create a subaccount as `data.subaccount_id`

preauthorize.description: Pass this value as true to preauthorize a tokenized charge

get.description: Fetch all transactions on your account

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: This is the specified date to start the list from. YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The is the specified end period for the search . YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: This is the page number to retrieve e.g. setting 1 retrieves the first page

parameters.name: customer_email
parameters.description: This is the email of the customer who carried out a transaction. Use for more specific listing.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: This is the transaction status, can be set to successful, failed etc to filter the listing

parameters.name: tx_ref
parameters.description: This is the merchant reference tied to a transaction. Use for more specific listing

parameters.name: customer_fullname
parameters.description: This is the combination of the customer first name and last name passed to rave during transaction.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: This is the currency the transaction list should come in e.g. NGN, USD, EUR, GHS, KES, GBP and ZAR

post.description: This endpoint allows you to charge multiple payment tokens at once.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

retry_strategy.description: This is an object that defines what should happen when the transaction fails. It contains 3 properties (retry_interval, retry_amount_variable, retry_attempt_variable)

retry_interval.description: This is the number of mins it should take for the retry to happen

retry_amount_variable.description: This is the amount that would be retried after the specified number of attempts in percentage

retry_attempt_variable.description: This is the number of times the retry should happen

last_retry_attempt.description: This is the maximum number of retries. If not set 10 attempts will be made.

bulk_data.description: An array of objects containing the tokenized bulk charge data. This array contains the same payload you passed to the single tokenize endpoint with multiple different values.

currency.description: his is the specified currency to charge the card in, It can be NGN, GHS, KES, UGX, TZS, USD etc.

token.description: This is the card token returned from the transaction verification endpoint as data.card.token

country.description: This is the ISO country code of the merchant e.g. NG, GH, KE etc.

amount.description: This is the amount to be charged

tx_ref.description: This is the unique reference, unique to the particular transaction being carried out. It is generated by the merchant for every transaction

email.description: This is the email address of the customer

first_name.description: This is the first name of the card holder or the customer

last_name.description: This is the last name of the card holder or the customer

ip.description: IP - Internet Protocol. This represents the IP address of where the transaction is being carried out.

code-samples.name: Ruby

post.description: This will show you how to initiate a transfer

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

account_bank.description: This is the recipient bank code. You can see a list of all the available banks and their codes [here](https://developer.flutterwave.com/reference#get-all-banks).

account_number.description: This is the recipient account number. When testing on staging, you can find a list of test bank accounts [here](https://developer.flutterwave.com/docs/test-bank-accounts).

amount.description: This is the amount to transfer to the recipient

narration.description: This is the narration for the transfer e.g. payments for x services provided

currency.description: This can be `NGN`, `GHS`, `KES`, `UGX`, `TZS`, `USD` or `ZAR`

beneficiary_name.description: This is the first name and last name of the beneficiary.

destination_branch_code.description: This code uniquely identifies bank branches for disbursements into Ghana, Uganda and Tanzania. It is returned in the call to fetch bank branches here: https://developer.flutterwave.com/v3.0/reference#get-bank-branches. It is only REQUIRED for GHS, UGX, XOF, XAF ZMW, and TZS bank transfers

beneficiary.description: This is the beneficiary's id. It allows you to initiate a transfer to an existing beneficiary. You can pass this in place of `account_bank` & `account_number`. It is returned in the call to fetch a beneficiary as `data.id`

reference.description: This is a merchant's unique reference for the transfer, it can be used to query for the status of the transfer.

callback_url.description: This is a url passed by you the developer, Flutterwave would pass the final transfer response to this callback url. You can use this in place of Webhooks

debit_currency.description: You can pass this when you want to debit a currency balance and send money in another currency.

meta.description: This is an object you can use to add any additional payment information you would like to associate with this transfer. Note that this object is REQUIRED for ZAR and KES payouts.

first_name.description: This is the first name of the transfer recipient

last_name.description: This is the last name of the transfer recipient

email.description: This is the email address of the transfer recipient

mobile_number.description: This is the mobile number of the recipient. If the recipient's email address is passed, this becomes an optional parameter.

recipient_address.description: This is the address of the transfer recipient.

sender.description: This is the senders first and last name

debit_subaccount.description: This is required if the debit wallet is a Payout SubAccount.

meta.BankName: BANK OF AMERICA, N.A., SAN FRANCISCO, CA

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request POST '{{BASE_API_URL}}/transfers' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}' \
--data-raw '{
    "account_bank": "044",
    "account_number": "0690000040",
    "amount": 5500,
    "narration": "Akhlm Pstmn Trnsfr xx007",

get.description: Fetch all transfers on your account

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: This allows you fetch from a specific page e.g. setting page to 1 fetches the first page.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: This allows you fetch only transfers with a specific status e.g. fetch all successful transactions. Possible values are failed, successful

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: This is the currency of the transfer

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: This is the start date for the fetch in format "YYYY-MM-DD"

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: This is the end date for the fetch in format "YYYY-MM-DD"

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: This is the number of records to return per page

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request GET '{{BASE_API_URL}}/transfers' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}'

code-samples.name: Node

code-samples.code:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => "{{BASE_API_URL}}/transfers",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
  CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
    "Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}"
  ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

require "uri"
require "net/http"

url = URI("{{BASE_API_URL}}/transfers")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port);
request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)
request["Authorization"] = "Bearer {SEC_KEY}"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

post.description: This document shows you how to initiate a bulk transfer

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

bulk_data.description: An array of objects containing the transfer charge data. This array contains the same payload you would passed to create a single transfer with multiple different values.

bank_code.description: This is the recipients bank code

account_number.description: This is the recipient account number

amount.description: This is the amount for the service you would like to buy.

currency.description: This is the debit currency for the transfer. It can be NGN, GHS, KES, UGX, TZS, or USD

narration.description: This is the narration for the transfer e.g. payments for x services provided

reference.description: This is a merchant's unique reference for the transfer, it can be used to query for the status of the transfer

meta.description: This is an object you can use to add any additional payment information you would like to associate with this transfer. Note that this object is REQUIRED for ZAR payouts.

first_name.description: This is the first name of the transfer recipient

last_name.description: This is the last name of the transfer recipient

email.description: This is the email address of the transfer recipient

mobile_number.description: This is the mobile number of the recipient. If the recipient's email address is passed, this becomes an optional parameter.

recipient_address.description: This is the address of the transfer recipient.

sender.description: This is the senders first and last name

}'

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => "{{BASE_API_URL}}/bulk-transfers/",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
  CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS =>"{\n    \"title\": \"Staff salary\",\n    \"bulk_data\": [\n        {\n            \"bank_code\": \"044\",\n            \"account_numberr\": \"0690000032\",\n            \"amount\": 45000,\n            \"currency\": \"NGN\",\n            \"narration\": \"akhlm blktrnsfr\",\n            \"reference\": \"akhlm-blktrnsfr-xx03\"\n        },\n        {\n            \"bank_code\": \"044\",\n            \"account_number\": \"0690000034\",\n            \"amount\": 5000,\n            \"currency\": \"NGN\",\n            \"narration\": \"akhlm blktrnsfr\",\n            \"reference\": \"akhlm-blktrnsfr-xy03\"\n        }\n    ]\n}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
    "Content-Type: application/json",
    "Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}"
  ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

require "net/http"

}"

post.description: Create a payment plan

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

amount.description: This is the amount to charge all customers subscribed to this plan

name.description: This is the name of the payment plan, it will appear on the subscription reminder emails

interval.description: This will determine the frequency of the charges for this plan. Could be `yearly`, `quarterly`, `monthly`, `weekly`, `daily`, etc.

duration.description: This is the frequency, it is numeric, e.g. if set to 5 and intervals is set to monthly you would be charged 5 months, and then the subscription stops

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request POST '{{BASE_API_URL}}/payment-plans' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}' \
--data-raw '{
    "amount": 5000,
    "name": "the akhlm postman plan 2",
    "interval": "monthly",
    "duration": 48
}'

code-samples.name: Node

code-samples.code:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => "{{BASE_API_URL}}/payment-plans",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
  CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS =>"{\n    \"amount\": 5000,\n    \"name\": \"the akhlm postman plan 2\",\n    \"interval\": \"monthly\",\n    \"duration\": 48\n}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
    "Content-Type: application/json",
    "Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}"
  ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

require "uri"
require "net/http"

url = URI("{{BASE_API_URL}}/payment-plans")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port);
request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)
request["Content-Type"] = "application/json"
request["Authorization"] = "Bearer {SEC_KEY}"
request.body = "{\n    \"amount\": 5000,\n    \"name\": \"the akhlm postman plan 2\",\n    \"interval\": \"monthly\",\n    \"duration\": 48\n}"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

get.description: Fetch all payment plans on your account

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: This is the specified date to start the list from. YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The is the specified end period for the search.  YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: This is the page number to retrieve e.g. setting 1 retrieves the first page

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: This is the exact amount set when creating the payment plan

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: This is the currency the payment plan amount is charged in

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: This is how often the payment plan is set to execute

parameters.name: status

get.description: Get all subscriptions

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: This is the email of the subscribers

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: This is the id of the transaction. It is returned in the call to verify a transaction as `data.id`

parameters.name: plan
parameters.description: This is the ID of the payment plan. It is returned in the call to create a payment plan as `data.id`

parameters.name: subscribed_from
parameters.description: This is the params to filter from the start date of the subscriptions

parameters.name: subscribed_to
parameters.description: This is the params to filter to the end date of the subscriptions

parameters.name: next_due_from
parameters.description: This is the params to filter from the start date of the next due subscriptions

parameters.name: next_due_to
parameters.description: This is the params to filter to the end date of the next due subscriptions

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: This is the page number to retrieve e.g. setting 1 retrieves the first page

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: This is the params used to filter the list of subscription based on the status which can be either `active` or `cancelled`

post.description: Create a new virtual card

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

currency.description: This is the currency the card would be denominated in

amount.description: This is the amount to prefund the card with on card creation

debit_currency.description: Use this if you want to debit a different balance on Flutterwave to fund your card e.g. you are funding a USD card but you want to debit your NGN balance to fund the card

billing_name.description: This is the name that will appear on the card

billing_address.description: This is the registered address for the card. e.g. Your house address where you would receive your card statements

billing_city.description: This is the City / District / Suburb / Town / Village registered for the card

billing_state.description: This is the State / County / Province / Region. It is a two letter word representing the state in the billing country e.g CA, NY

billing_country.description: Billing address country code, if provided. (e.g. "NG", "US")

callback_url.description: This is a callback endpoint you provide where we send details about any transaction that occurs on the card.

get.description: Fetch transactions by date range on a single card

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This is the unique id of the particular card you want to fetch all its transactions. You can get this `id` from the call to create a virtual card as `data.id`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: This is the start date of the transaction request period

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: This is the end date of the transaction request period

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Pass 0 if you want to start from the beginning

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Specify how many transactions you want to retrieve in a single call

Result.value:
{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Card transactions fetched successfully",

code-samples.code:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => "{{BASE_API_URL}}/virtual-cards/38c9201a-fcb2-48fd-875e-6494ed79a6bb/transactions?from=2019-01-01&to=2020-01-13&index=1&size=5",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
  CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
    "Content-Type: application/json",
    "Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}"

));

require "net/http"

post.description: Withdraw existing funds from a virtual card

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This is the unique id of the particular card you want to withdraw funds from. You can get this `id` from the call to create a virtual card as `data.id`

amount.description: This is the amount you want to withdraw

code-samples.code:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => "{{BASE_API_URL}}/virtual-cards/38c9201a-fcb2-48fd-875e-6494ed79a6bb/withdraw",

  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,

  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS =>"{\n    \"amount\": 500000\n}",

    "Content-Type: application/json",

  ),

post.description: This document shows you how to create a subaccount on Flutterwave

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

account_bank.description: This is the sub-accounts bank ISO code, use the [List of Banks for Transfer endpoint](https://developer.flutterwave.com/v3.0/reference#get-all-banks) to retrieve a list of bank codes.

account_number.description: This is the customer's account number. When testing on staging, you can find a list of all available test bank accounts [here](https://developer.flutterwave.com/docs/test-bank-accounts)

business_name.description: This is the sub-account business name.

country.description: This is the ISO country code of the merchant e.g. NG, GH, KE etc.

split_value.description: This can be a percentage value or flat value depending on what was set on split_type.Note that the % value is in decimal. So 50% is 0.5 and so on.

business_email.description: This is the sub-account business email

business_contact.description: This is the contact person for the sub-account e.g. Richard Hendrix

split_type.description: This can be set as percentage or flat

meta.description: This is an array that allows you pass more information about the sub-account. Click the **Add** button below to see sample properties

meta_name.description: This allows you pass extra information (key) about the sub-account.

meta_value.description: This allows you pass extra information (value of `meta_name`) about the sub-account.

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request POST '{{BASE_API_URL}}/subaccounts' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}' \
--data-raw '{
    "account_bank": "044",
    "account_number": "0690000037",
    "business_name": "Eternal Blue",
    "business_email": "petya@stux.net",
    "business_contact": "Anonymous",
    "business_contact_mobile": "090890382",
    "business_mobile": "09087930450",
    "country": "NG",
    "split_type": "percentage",
    "split_value": 0.5
}'

code-samples.code:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
  CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS =>"{\n    \"account_bank\": \"044\",\n    \"account_number\": \"0690000037\",\n    \"business_name\": \"Eternal Blue\",\n    \"business_email\": \"petya@stux.net\",\n    \"business_contact\": \"Anonymous\",\n    \"business_contact_mobile\": \"090890382\",\n    \"business_mobile\": \"09087930450\",\n    \"country\": \"NG\",\n    \"meta\": [\n        {\n            \"meta_name\": \"mem_adr\",\n            \"meta_value\": \"0x16241F327213\"\n        }\n    ],\n    \"split_type\": \"percentage\",\n    \"split_value\": 0.5\n}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
    "Content-Type: application/json",

));

}"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

email.description: This could be a generic email address

bvn.description: This is only required for static accounts It should be BVN number tied to the user the account number is being generated for

amount.description: The desired amount to be collected

tx_ref.description: This is a transaction reference that would be returned each time a transfer is done to the account

is_permanent.description: This allows you create a static account number i.e. it doesn't expire

narration.description: This allows you specify the name shown when the account is resolved
narration.default: Please make a bank transfer to John

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request GET '{{BASE_API_URL}}/bills' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json'

code-samples.name: Node

code-samples.code:
<?php
require_once 'HTTP/Request2.php';
$request = new HTTP_Request2();
$request->setUrl('{{BASE_API_URL}}/bills');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_Request2::METHOD_POST);
$request->setConfig(array(
  'follow_redirects' => TRUE
));
$request->setHeader(array(
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer {SEC_KEY}',
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
));
$request->setBody('{\n	"country": "NG",\n	"customer": "+23490803840303",\n	"amount": 500,\n	"recurrence": "ONCE",\n	"type": "AIRTIME",\n	"reference": "9300049404444"\n }');
try {
  $response = $request->send();
  if ($response->getStatus() == 200) {
    echo $response->getBody();
  }
  else {
    echo 'Unexpected HTTP status: ' . $response->getStatus() . ' ' .
    $response->getReasonPhrase();
  }
}
catch(HTTP_Request2_Exception $e) {
  echo 'Error: ' . $e->getMessage();
}

require "net/http"

request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)
request["Authorization"] = "Bearer {SEC_KEY}"
request["Content-Type"] = "application/json"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

post.description: This document shows you how to create bill payments

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description: This is an optional parameter you can pass to get more details about the bill. E.g:  the status and token of the bill payment is added to the response when this parameter is passed

country.description: This is the country attached to the service being bought e.g. if service is `Airtime` and country is `NG` it means you are buying airtime in Nigeria.

customer.description: This is the customer identifier. For airtime, the value must be the customer's phone number. For DSTV, it must be the customer's smartcard number

amount.description: This is the amount for the service you would like to buy.

recurrence.description: This determines if you are buying a service recurrently or not. ONCE - This is a one time payment, HOURLY - This is an hourly payment, DAILY - This is a daily payment, WEEKLY - This is a weekly payment, MONTHLY - This is a monthly payment. It defaults to ONCE when the value is not provided

type.description: Fetch the possible values to pass from `data.biller_name` on the [Bill categories](https://developer.flutterwave.com/reference#get-bill-categories) endpoint. Note that these values are case sensitive and must be passed exactly the way it was returned on the Categories API

reference.description: This is a unique reference passed by the developer to identify transactions on their end

biller_name.description: This is the particular biller you're paying to. You can get a list of all the possible billers [here] (https://api.flutterwave.com/v3/bill-categories). Only pass this value for Ghana Airtime bills
biller_name.default: DSTV, MTN VTU, TIGO VTU, VODAFONE VTU, VODAFONE POSTPAID PAYMENT

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request POST '{{BASE_API_URL}}/bills' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
	"country": "NG",
	"customer": "+23490803840303",
	"amount": 500,
	"recurrence": "ONCE",
	"type": "AIRTIME",
	"reference": "9300049404444"
 }'

));
$request->setBody('{\n	"country": "NG",\n	"customer": "+23490803840303",\n	"amount": 500,\n	"recurrence": "ONCE",\n	"type": "AIRTIME",\n	"reference": "9300049404444"\n }');
try {
  $response = $request->send();
  if ($response->getStatus() == 200) {

}

}

post.description: This document shows you how to create bulk bills payment

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

bulk_reference.description: This is a reference that identifies the batch request being made for bulk requests

callback_url.description: This is an endpoint supplied by you the developer/merchant so we can send a response when each request in the bulk is completed

bulk_data.description: This is an array containing each individual requests in the batch.

bank_code.description: This is the recipients bank code

account_number.description: This is the recipient account number

amount.description: This is the amount for the service you would like to buy.

currency.description: This is the debit currency for the transfer. It can be NGN, GHS, KES, UGX, TZS, or USD

narration.description: This is the narration for the transfer e.g. payments for x services provided

reference.description: This is a merchant's unique reference for the transfer, it can be used to query for the status of the transfer

meta.description: This is an object you can use to add any additional payment information you would like to associate with this transfer. Note that this object is REQUIRED for ZAR payouts.

first_name.description: This is the first name of the transfer recipient

last_name.description: This is the last name of the transfer recipient

email.description: This is the email address of the transfer recipient

mobile_number.description: This is the mobile number of the recipient. If the recipient's email address is passed, this becomes an optional parameter.

recipient_address.description: This is the address of the transfer recipient.

sender.description: This is the senders first and last name

message.example: Bulk bill Payment was queued for processing

post.summary: Create order using billing code and product code
post.description: This document shows you how to create an order using the biller code and the product code

parameters.name: biller_code
parameters.description: This is the biller's code

parameters.name: product_code
parameters.description: This is the id of the product

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

customer.description: This is an object with the name, email and phone number of the customer.

email.description: This is the customer's email

phone_number.description: This is the customer's phone number

fields.description: This is an array of the id, quatity and value of the order

quantity.description: This is the quantity of the order

value.description: This is the value of the order

country.description: This is the country attached to the service being bought e.g. if Service is Airtime and country is NG it means you are buying airtime in Nigeria

amount.description: This is the amount for the service you would like to order.

reference.description: This is a unique reference passed by the developer to identify transactions on their end.

code-samples.name: Node

code-samples.code:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => "{{BASE_API_URL}}/billers/BIL136/products/OT151/orders",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
  CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS =>"{\n    \"amount\": \"3500.00\",\n    \"reference\": \"FLWTTOT1000000029\",\n    \"customer\": {\n        \"name\": \"emmanuel\",\n        \"email\": \"emmanuel@x.com\",\n        \"phone_number\": \"08060811638\"\n    },\n    \"fields\": [\n        {\n            \"id\": \"42107711:42107712\",\n            \"quantity\": \"1\",\n            \"value\": \"3500\"\n        },\n        {\n            \"id\": \"42107710\",\n            \"quantity\": \"1\",\n            \"value\": \"t@x.com\"\n        }\n    ]\n}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
    "Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}",
    "Content-Type: application/json"
  ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

post.description: This document shows you how to create an otp

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

length.description: This is Integer length you want for the OTP.

customer.description: This is an object with the name, email and phone number of the customer.

sender.description: This is your merchant/business name. It would display when the OTP is sent

send.description: Set to true to send otp to customer

medium.description: Pass the medium you want your customers to receive the OTP on. Possible values are sms, email and whatsapp you can pass more than one medium in the array"

expiry.description: Pass an integer value represented in minutes for how long you want the OTP to live for before expiring

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request POST '{{BASE_API_URL}}/otps' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
	"length": 7,
	"customer": { "name": "Kazan", "email": "kazan@mailinator.com", "phone": "2348131149273" },
	"sender": "log t",
	"send": true,
	"medium": ["email", "whatsapp"],
	"expiry": 5
}'

post.description:
This document describes how to charge a card using Flutterwave's APIs
**Note: This API requires one to have a valid PCI-DSS Certificate to charge cards with your Live API Keys**

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

amount.description: This is the amount to be charged.

currency.description: This is the specified currency to charge in.

card_number.description: This is the number on the cardholders card. E.g. 5399 6701 2349 0229.

cvv.description: Card security code. This is 3/4 digit code at the back of the customers card, used for web payments.

expiry_month.description: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

expiry_year.description: Two digit number representing the card's expiration year

email.description: This is the email address of the customer

tx_ref.description: This is a unique reference peculiar to the transaction being carried out.

phone_number.description: This is the phone number linked to the customer's mobile money account

fullname.description: This is the name of the customer.

preauthorize.description: This should be set to true for preauthoize card transactions

redirect_url.description: This is a url you provide, we redirect to it after the customer completes payment and append the response to it as query parameters. (3DSecure only)

client_ip.description: IP - Internet Protocol. This represents the current IP address of the customer carrying out the transaction

device_fingerprint.description: This is the fingerprint for the device being used. It can be generated using a library on whatever platform is being used

meta.description: This is used to include additional payment information

flightID.description: This could be the extra information you want to pass

sideNote.description: This could be any message you'd like to associate with this call
sideNote.default: This is a side note to track this call

authorization.description: This is an object that contains the authorization details of the card you want to charge. The authorization instructions for card charges are returned in the initiate charge call as `meta.authorization`

mode.description: This is the auth model of the card to use when validating, it is returned in the initiate charge call as `authorization.mode`

pin.description: This is the card's pin. Required when the suggested auth mode is PIN

city.description: This is the city in the card's billing details. It is required when the suggested auth mode is `avs_noauth`

address.description: This is the cards billing address. It is required when the suggested auth mode is `avs_noauth`

state.description: This is the card issuing state. It is required when the suggested auth mode is `avs_noauth`

country.description: This is the cards issuing country. It is required when the suggested auth mode is `avs_noauth`

zipcode.description: This is cards billing address zipcod. It is required when the suggested auth mode is `avs_noauth`

payment_plan.description: This is the id of a previously created payment plan needed to add a card user to the payment plan.

post.description: This shows you how to validate a pending transaction

type.description: This recognises the type of payment you want to validate. Set to account if you want to validate an `account` transaction and set to `card` for card transactions

post.description: This document describes how to collect payments via Ghana mobile money.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

amount.description: This is the amount to be charged.

currency.description: This is the specified currency to charge the card in. With Flutterwave you can charge cards in more than 90 currencies, all you need to do is pass the specified currency you would like to charge the in

email.description: This is the email address of the customer

tx_ref.description: This is a unique reference, unique to the particular transaction being carried out.

phone_number.description: This is the phone number linked to the customer's mobile money account

network.description: This is the customer's mobile money network provider (possible values: MTN, VODAFONE, TIGO)

fullname.description: This is the customers full name. It should include first and last name of the customer

client_ip.description: IP - Internet Protocol. This represents the current IP address of the customer carrying out the transaction

device_fingerprint.description: This is the fingerprint for the device being used. It can be generated using a library on whatever platform is being used

meta.description: This is used to include additional payment information

flightID.description: This could be the extra information you want to pass

sideNote.description: This could be any message you'd like to associate with this call
sideNote.default: This is a side note to track this call

redirect_url.description: This is a url you provide, we redirect to it after the customer completes payment and append the response to it as query parameters.

client_ip.description: IP - Internet Protocol. This represents the current IP address of the customer carrying out the transaction

device_fingerprint.description: This is the fingerprint for the device being used. It can be generated using a library on whatever platform is being used

meta.description: This is used to include additional payment information

flightID.description: This could be the extra information you want to pass

sideNote.description: This could be any message you'd like to associate with this call
sideNote.default: This is a side note to track this call

passcode.description: This is required for Zenith bank account payments, you are required to collect the customer's date of birth and pass it in this format DDMMYYYY as the passcode.

bvn.description: This is the customer's BVN number (It is only required for UBA account payment option)

validate_instructions.example: Please validate with the OTP sent to your mobile or email

post.description: This allows your customer to pay via a NIP (NIBBS Instant Payment) transfer.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

amount.description: This is the amount to be charged.

email.description: This is the email address of the customer

currency.description: This is the specified currency to charge in. (expected value: NGN)

tx_ref.description: This is a unique reference, unique to the particular transaction being carried out.

fullname.description: This is the customers full name. It should include first and last name of the customer

phone_number.description: This is the phone number linked to the customer's mobile money account

client_ip.description: IP - Internet Protocol. This represents the current IP address of the customer carrying out the transaction

device_fingerprint.description: This is the fingerprint for the device being used. It can be generated using a library on whatever platform is being used

meta.description: This is used to include additional payment information

flightID.description: This could be the extra information you want to pass

sideNote.description: This could be any message you'd like to associate with this call
sideNote.default: This is a side note to track this call

subaccounts.description: This is an array of objects containing the subaccount IDs to split the payment into.

id.description: This is the unique Id returned in the call to create a subaccount as `data.subaccount_id`

narration.description: This allows the developer set the name that is shown to the customer when the account is resolved to a name. It also displays in the debit narration.

is_permanent.description: This allows you to create a static account number i.e. the account number doesn't change and customers can pay into the account number multiple times.

value.narration: All star college salary for May

transfer_note.example: Please make a bank transfer to Yemi Desola

post.description: This page describes how to collect payments via mobile money for Franc.

parameters.name: Authorization

amount.description: This is the amount to be charged it is passed as - ('amount':'100'). N.B. Amount should not be less than 100."

currency.description: This is the specified currency to charge in. (expected value: XAF or XOF)

phone_number.description: This is the phone number linked to the customer's mobile money account

email.description: This is the email address of the customer

country.description: This is the country code of the francophone country making the mobile money payment. Possible values are CM (Cameroon), SN (Senegal), BF (Burkina Faso) and so on.

fullname.description: This is the customers full name. It should include first and last name of the customer

get.description: This document will show you how to verify card bins on Flutterwave

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

parameters.name: bin
parameters.description: The first 6 six digits on a debit/credit card

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request GET '{{BASE_API_URL}}/card-bins/123456' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}'

code-samples.name: Node

code-samples.code:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => "{{BASE_API_URL}}/card-bins/123456",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
  CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
    "Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}"
  ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

require "uri"
require "net/http"

url = URI("{{BASE_API_URL}}/card-bins/123456")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port);
request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)
request["Authorization"] = "Bearer {SEC_KEY}"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

get.description: This allows you to fetch all chargebacks on your account

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: This specifies which page you want to fetch.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: This specifies the status of the chargebacks you want to fetch. It can be `lost`, `won`, `initiated`, `accepted`, `declined` .

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: This is the start date for the record you want to fetch. Date format is YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: This is the end date for the record you want to fetch. Date format is YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: flw_ref
parameters.description: This is the unique reference for the transaction. It can be retrieved from the initial chargeback response as `flw_ref`

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request GET '{{BASE_API_URL}}/chargebacks' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json'

put.description: This allows you to perform actions like `decline` or `accept` chargebacks on your account

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the chargeback you want to accept/decline

action.description: This is the action you want to perform on the chargeback. I t can be `accept` or `decline`

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request GET '{{BASE_API_URL}}/chargebacks/143' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json'

get.description: This allows you to fetch all chargebacks on your account

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

parameters.name: flw_ref
parameters.description: This is the flutterwave reference associated with a particular charge back. Pass this value when you want to fetch a single chargeback

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request GET '{{BASE_API_URL}}/chargebacks?flw_ref=Flutterwave-refernce-value' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json'
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}'

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request GET '{{BASE_API_URL}}/bill-categories' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json'

code-samples.name: Node

code-samples.code:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => "{{BASE_API_URL}}/bill-categories",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
  CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
    "Authorization: Bearer {SEC_KEY}",
    "Content-Type: application/json"
  ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

require "uri"
require "net/http"

url = URI("{{BASE_API_URL}}/bill-categories")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port);
request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)
request["Authorization"] = "Bearer {SEC_KEY}"
request["Content-Type"] = "application/json"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

post.description: This document describes how to collect payments via ussd

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

account_bank.description: This is the bank numeric code e.g 058. You can get a list of supported banks and their respective codes below.

amount.description: This is the amount to be charged. Expected value is NGN

currency.description: This is the specified currency to charge in. (expected value: NGN)

email.description: This is the email address of the customer

tx_ref.description: This is a unique reference, unique to the particular transaction being carried out.

fullname.description: This is the customers full name. It should include first and last name of the customer

phone_number.description: This is the phone number linked to the customer's mobile money account

client_ip.description: IP - Internet Protocol. This represents the current IP address of the customer carrying out the transaction

device_fingerprint.description: This is the fingerprint for the device being used. It can be generated using a library on whatever platform is being used

meta.description: This is used to include additional payment information

flightID.description: This could be the extra information you want to pass

sideNote.description: This could be any message you'd like to associate with this call
sideNote.default: This is a side note to track this call

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: This is the amount to transfer to the recipient

parameters.name: destination_currency
parameters.description: This is the wallet / currency you are making a transfer to.

parameters.name: source_currency
parameters.description: This is the wallet / currency to be debited for the transfer

--data-raw ''

post.description: This section describes how to charge customer using the PayPal method.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Pass your secret key as a bearer token in the request header to authorize this call

tx_ref.description: This is a unique reference peculiar to the transaction being carried out.

amount.description: This is the amount to be charged.

currency.description: This is the specified currency to charge in.

email.description: This is the email address of the customer

phone_number.description: This is the phone number linked to the customer's mobile money account.

fullname.description: This is the name of the customer.

redirect_url.description: This is a url you provide, we redirect to it after the customer completes payment and append the response to it as query parameters.

device_fingerprint.description: This is the fingerprint for the device being used. It can be generated using a library on whatever platform is being used

meta.description: This is used to include additional payment information specific to the merchant or product. See more details on metas and STCs [here](https://developer.flutterwave.com/docs/adding-stcs-to-your-paypal-requests).

billing_address.description: This is the house/building address registered with the card. Customers can easily find this on their bank statement

billing_city.description: This is the city registered with the card, it makes up part of the address the customer used for their card.

billing_state.description: This is the country registered with the card.

billing_country.description: This is the country registered with the card.

billing_zip.description: This is the zip code or postal card registered with the card,

shipping_address.description: This is the destination house/building address.

shipping_city.description: This is the city the destination house/building is located in.

shipping_state.description: This is the state the destination house/building is located in.

shipping_country.description: This is the country the destination house/building is located in.

shipping_zip.description: This is the postal code of the destination house/building.

code-samples.code:
curl --location --request POST 'https://api.flutterwave.com/v3/charges?type=paypal' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer FLWSECK-xxxxxxxxxxxxxx-X' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
    "tx_ref": "PayPalv3Test03",
    "amount": "10",
    "currency": "USD",
    "country": "US",
    "email": "dovedom221@vss6.com",
    "phone_number": "054222234847",

package main

import (
  "fmt"
  "strings"
  "net/http"
  "io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

  url := "https://api.flutterwave.com/v3/charges?type=paypal"
  method := "POST"

  payload := strings.NewReader(`{
    "tx_ref": "PayPalv3Test03",
    "amount": "10",
    "currency": "USD",
    "country": "US",
    "email": "dovedom221@vss6.com",
    "phone_number": "054222234847",
    "fullname": "John Madakin",
    "client_ip": "154.123.220.1",
    "redirect_url": "http://johnmadakin.com/u/payment-completed",
    "device_fingerprint": "62wd23423rq324323qew1",
    "billing_address": "333 Fremont Street, San Francisco, CA",
    "billing_city": "San Francisco",
    "billing_zip": "94105",
    "billing_state": "California",
    "billing_country": "US",
    "shipping_name": "Robert K Gagne",
    "shipping_address": "1010  Woodrow Way",
    "shipping_city": "Lufkin",
    "shipping_zip": "75904",
    "shipping_state": "Texas",
    "shipping_country": "US"
  }`)

  client := &http.Client {
  }
  req, err := http.NewRequest(method, url, payload)

  if err != nil {
    fmt.Println(err)
    return
  }
  req.Header.Add("Authorization", "Bearer FLWSECK-xxxxxxxxxxxxxx-X")
  req.Header.Add("Content-Type", "application/json")

  res, err := client.Do(req)
  if err != nil {
    fmt.Println(err)
    return
  }
  defer res.Body.Close()

  body, err := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)
  if err != nil {
    fmt.Println(err)
    return
  }
  fmt.Println(string(body))
}

<?php
require_once 'HTTP/Request2.php';
$request = new HTTP_Request2();
$request->setUrl('https://api.flutterwave.com/v3/virtual-account-numbers/URF_1628865217526_1284135');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_Request2::METHOD_POST);
$request->setConfig(array(
  'follow_redirects' => TRUE
));
$request->setHeader(array(
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer FLWSECK_TEST-8fxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxe-X',
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
));
$request->setBody('{\n    "status": "inactive"\n}');
try {
  $response = $request->send();
  if ($response->getStatus() == 200) {
    echo $response->getBody();
  }
  else {
    echo 'Unexpected HTTP status: ' . $response->getStatus() . ' ' .
    $response->getReasonPhrase();
  }
}
catch(HTTP_Request2_Exception $e) {
  echo 'Error: ' . $e->getMessage();
}
